data.title: JSON coloring changes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.10.5 and Windows 10 (stable build 10586)

Updated from 0.10.11 to 1.0.0, JSON coloring changed between versions for my theme [Base16 Ocean](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=golf1052.theme-base16-ocean).

Before (Can't find a download link for 0.10.11 right now so i just edited the styling in dev tools to show what it looked like. The braces were grey.):
![](http://i.imgur.com/0mOioX4.png)

After:
![](http://i.imgur.com/uyuS0o3.png)

[Link to .tmTheme](https://github.com/golf1052/base16-ocean-vscode/blob/master/extension/themes/base16-ocean.dark.tmTheme)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Base16 Ocean extension and set theme to Ocean Dark
2. Open a JSON file, notice coloring
3. Update to 1.0.0
4. Open a JSON file, notice coloring

Testing with built in themes it seems like the issue is more the theme than VSCode but I do wonder why the coloring changed between versions.

data.title: [json] "Format Code" folds braces into preceding comments.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 10586

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Open a JSON file or blank file and set language to JSON
2) Enter the following (bug applies in all situations like this):

``` js
{ // comment
}
```

3) Alt+Shift+F (or Right Click -> Format Code, etc.)
4) Result is that the closing brace is folded into the comment:

``` js
{ // comment}
```

data.title: URL matching issue when non-ASCII character embedded
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

I just upgraded my VSCode to 1.0 release. Since it supports Traditional Chinese now, my default language was set to `zh-tw` so that some of comments in the newly added config file is in Chinese.

As you can see in the following screenshot, a Chinese character "。", which is equivalent to the period "." in English, was matched as part of valid URL, and it caused VSCode direct to a incorrect URL.

![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/W6v2B3J.png)

I have a working fix for this issue, the naive solution is to check if `chCode` in `src/vs/editor/common/modes/linkComputer.ts` is greater than **128**, which means a non-ASCII character. Why to match only ASCII character? Because when you copy a URL from most of web browsers to clipboard, it will be automatically converted into ASCII-only string.

Also, I came up with another idea to modify the `_cachedResult` to let it cache all the `CharacterClass` result of ASCII characters (0~127). In this way, we only need to modify the default case of the switch clause in the state machine.

Which solution is more preferable? Please give me some advice then I can submit the patch ASAP.

data.title: gulp vscode-linux-x64 produces a binary that opens a blank window
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

```
➜ git describe --always --abbrev=16
e3ac586869cc97e6
```
- OS Version:
  Arch Linux 64bit (kernel 4.4.5)

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  `cd $PATH_TO_VSCODE_GIT && ./node_modules/.bin/gulp vscode-linux-x64`
2. `../VSCode-linux-x64/bin/code-oss`

It opens the vscode window with just the menubar, none of the menu options does anything and no sidebar or status bar, also no errors.

data.title: Breakpoint is moving one step down and showing up "Unverified breakpoint" message while debugging.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version:Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and try to debug node.js (TS) project.
2. Configure task.json and Launch.json (sourceMaps = true and oudir:"path").
3. Delete any generated .js file, build project (CTRL+SHIFT+B) and set break point in .ts file.
4. Start debugging and verify whether debug points hit or not.

Actual: Debug point is hitting in .ts file but I observed that the breakpoint is moving one step down and due to that other breakpoints are affected and make them "Unverified breakpoint".

![breakpointissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14536434/362c0514-0227-11e6-834f-ec9013b038fa.gif)

data.title: C# needs to be written using HTML codes or escaped
data.body: The hash sign in the C# title needs to be written using HTML codes or escaped because as it stands now, people may think you're going to add debugging support for C or something weird. :)

data.title: Windows update packages might clash
data.body: Scoping [by commit](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-main/auto-updater.win32.ts#L112) is not enough, we need to mix in the quality in there.

data.title: DevTools broken most of the time
data.body:
Since the electron update the dev tools almost never survive a reload. That's a major setback for development.

Steps to reproduce
- run `./scripts/code.sh`
- open dev tools, set a breakpoint, debug a little
- change the file you have just debugged in source
- refresh workbench
- breakpoints are still there but not hit anymore

data.title: Attach to extension host: breakpoints ignored
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders but can also repro on latest vscode alpha
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open vscode repo in built VSCode 
2. `scripts/code.sh`
3. in the built VSCode choose 'Attach to Extension Host' and attach -> all looks good
4. Put some breakpoints in extension host code -> notice these breakpoints never get hit. Also notice that VSCode will not break on any exceptions
##### Additional info

Putting breakpoint in .js files and setting `sourceMaps` to `false` does not help.
Regular extension development / debugging is working just fine.
This used to work couple of milestones ago.
##### Example for step 4

Put breakpoint in `exHostOutputService.ts:53`. And from your extension try to show the output via the following snippet:

```
const outputChannel = vscode.window.createOutputChannel("Test");
outputChannel.show();
```

data.title: DNX Command does not work with spaces in path (still)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.15-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any .NET Core project
2. Hit F1, choose DNX Run Command, then dnx web

If there is a space in the path to the project, a command window opens with the error:

```
'C:\Users\John' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .
```

in my case, the path to the project is:
c:\Users\John Tsombakos\Documents\Visual Studio 2015\projects\Testapp

This problem still occurs after the supposed downstream dependencies have been fixed (OmniSharp and the Microsoft run-in-terminal packages)

data.title: var in identifiers get highlighted incorrectly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: **0.10.11**
- OS Version: **Windows 10**

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a JavaScript (or TypeScript) file.
2. Create a variable with the identifier of `variation` on `this` or an object's prototype.

Expected result: Highlighting is the same as any other variable.
Actual result: The `var` part of `variation` will be highlighted differently, even though it's part of an identifier name because (_I believe_) there's no preceding `var` on the same line. For example, `var variation = 0;` results in proper highlighting.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1019478/14532242/3f917d62-0215-11e6-9ea6-f3e8d13da25b.png)

- OS Version: Fedora 23

| File | Current | Request(zh-CN) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| editorStatus.i18n.json | `"spacesSize": "空间: {0}",` | `"spacesSize": "空格: {0}",` |

| editorStatus.i18n.json | `"singleSelection": "Ln {0}，Col {1}",` | `"singleSelection": "行 {0}，列 {1}",` |
| editorStatus.i18n.json | `"singleSelectionRange": "Ln {0}，Col {1} (已选择{2})",` | `"singleSelectionRange": "行 {0}，列 {1} (已选择{2})",` |
| menus.i18n.json | `"aboutDetail": "\n版本 {0}\n提交 {1}\n日期 {2}\nShell {3}\n呈现器 {4}\nNode {5}",` | `"aboutDetail": "\n版本 {0}\n提交 {1}\n日期 {2}\nShell {3}\n渲染器 {4}\nNode {5}",` |
| gitActions.i18n.json | `"pull": "拉",` | `"pull": "拉取 (Pull)",` |
| gitActions.i18n.json | `"pullWithRebase": "拉取(变基)",` | `"pullWithRebase": "拉取 (Rebase)",` |
| gitActions.i18n.json | `"push": "推送",` | `"push": "推送 (Push)",` |
| indentation.i18n.json | `"indentationToSpaces": "将缩进转换为空白",` | `"indentationToSpaces": "将缩进转换为空格",` |
| indentation.i18n.json | `"indentUsingSpaces": "使用空格的缩进",` | `"indentUsingSpaces": "使用空格缩进",` |
| indentation.i18n.json | `"indentUsingTabs": "使用 \"Tab\" 的缩进",` | `"indentUsingTabs": "使用 \"Tab\" 缩进",` |
| indentation.i18n.json | `"toggleRenderWhitespace": "切换呈现空格"` | `"toggleRenderWhitespace": "切换显示空格"` |

commonEditorConfig.i18n.json
Current: `"wrappingIndent": "控制换行的行的缩进。可以是“无”、“相同”或“缩进”。"`
Request: `"wrappingIndent": "控制换行时的缩进。可选项为 'none'、'same' 或 'indent'。"`

Current: `"cursorBlinking": "控制光标闪烁动画，接受的值为“闪烁”、“可见”和“隐藏”",`

Current: `"cursorStyle": "控制光标样式，接受的值为“块”和“行”",`
Request: `"cursorStyle": "控制光标样式，接受的值为 'block' 和 'line'",`

data.title: Improve performance of vscode while being accessed remotely
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Win7

Editing code on a remote system is currently a bit slow when using Visual Studio Code. Scrolling in particular seems to take longer to redraw than other editors like full visual studio or notepad++. It would be a great new feature if the GUI was optimized to redraw faster over remote desktop.

data.title: Mac non admin user does not have permission to change .vscode folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. (May be necessary to Install Unity, Unity Sample Project, and Unity VS Code plugin) 2. (I first debugged Unity successfully in VS Code with a user that has admin privileges) 3. Log into OS X with a User that does not have admin privileges. 4. Start VS Code.
Following the steps for Unity Debugging Support listed here: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Unity.unity-debug 5. Delete .vscode/Launch.json file 6. Try to recreate Launch.json file from inside VS Code by selecting "Unity Debugger" Result: Unable to create 'launch.json' file inside the '.vscode' folder (Error: EACCES: permission denied, open '/Users/Shared/Unity/Standard Assets Example Project/.vscode/launch.json'). Desired Result: File will be created successfully. Reason: The .vscode folder's permissions for a non admin user is "Read only". The folder permissions need to be "Read & Write" Current Workaround: In OS X Finder, manually change the access permissions of the .vscode folder to "Read & Write"
